Pre-Game Insights: Colombia will take Chile in the tenth round of the South American World Championship Qualification at 20:30 local time on October 15, 2024.
The game will take place at the 46,789 spectator capacity Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez in Barranquilla.
Venezuelan referee Valenzuela J. will officiate the game.
Chile sorely needs to raise their position in the CONMEBOL standings and Colombia aims to get vital points on their road to qualifying for the World Cup.
Colombia, after a disappointing loss to Bolivia, will be looking to regain momentum at home, where they’ve been solid throughout this campaign.
Chile, struggling with only five points in nine matches, will try to defy the odds and claim a rare away victory.
Both teams will be highly motivated, and this match promises to be a significant turning point for both in the qualification process.
Colombia has a great home record, while Chile has struggled with only two goals in their last six matches and four losses in the same period.
Chile will miss key players such as Alexis Sanchez, Matias Catalan, and Vicente Pizarro due to injuries or suspensions.
Colombia’s Luis Díaz has scored four goals at home in World Cup qualifiers and remains a key figure in the attack.
The hot and humid climate in Barranquilla could affect Chile’s performance, as they are not accustomed to these conditions.
